docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: http helper methods
HttpHelper
docblock.long-description: Helper methods for HTTP request/response handling

docblock.description: HTTP POST string constant
HTTP PUT string constant
HTTP DELETE string constant
HTTP GET string constant
Chunk size (number of bytes processed in one batch)
End of line mark used in HTTP
Validate an HTTP request method name

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if an invalid method name is supplied

docblock.description: Create a request string (header and body)
Execute an HTTP request on an opened socket It is the caller's responsibility to close the socket

tag.name: param
tag.description: - complete HTTP request as a string

tag.name: return
tag.description: - HTTP response string as provided by the server

docblock.description: Create a one-time HTTP connection by opening a socket to the server It is the caller's responsibility to close the socket

tag.name: return
tag.description: - socket with server connection, will throw when no connection can be established

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: scope
Scope
docblock.long-description: Executes a function on scope entry and executes another function (cleanup) when the scope is exited

docblock.description: Scope has not been entered
Scope has been entered but not left
Scope has been entered and left
Initialization function (called on scope entry)
Exit function (called when scope is left)
Value returned by call to init function
Current scope state
Initialise the scope

tag.name: param
tag.description: - function to be called when scope is entered

tag.name: param
tag.description: - function to be called when scope if left

docblock.description: Destroy the scope This will call leave() to ensure the scope is definitely left
Leave the scope This will execute the exit func with the value returned by the call to the init func.
docblock.long-description: leave() will check whether the scope has already been left to avoid duplicate execution of the exit func.

docblock.description: Enter the scope This will call the init func and store its result value
Clone function Scopes should never be cloned so this is private
AvocadoDB PHP client: exception base class
Exception
docblock.long-description: Exception base class used to throw Avocado specific exceptions

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: autoloader
Autoloader
docblock.long-description: Handles automatic loading of missing class files The autoloader can be nested with other autoloaders. It will only process classes from its own namespace and ignore all others.

docblock.description: Class file extension
Directory with library files
Initialise the autoloader
Handle loading of an unknown class
docblock.long-description: This will only handle class from its own namespace and ignore all others. This allows multiple autoloaders to be used in a nested fashion.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - name of class to be loaded

docblock.description: Check the runtime environment
docblock.long-description: This will check whether the runtime environment is compatible with the Avocado PHP client.

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: default values
Defaults
docblock.long-description: Contains default values used by the server

docblock.description: Default port number (used if no port specified)
Default timeout value (used if no timeout value specified)
AvocadoDB PHP client: server exception
ServerException
docblock.long-description: This will be thrown by the client when the server returns an error in response to a client request. The exception code is the HTTP status code as returned by the server. In case the server provides additional details about the error, these details can be queried using the getDetails() function.

docblock.description: Error number index
Error message index
Optional details for the exception
Set exception details
docblock.long-description: If the server provides additional details about the error that occurred, they will be put here.

docblock.description: Get exception details
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, they can be queries using the method

docblock.description: Get server error code
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, this will return the server error code

docblock.description: Get server error message
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, this will return the server error string

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: connection
Connection
docblock.long-description: Provides access to the AvocadoDB server As all access is done using HTTP, we do not need to establish a persistent connection and keep its state. Instead, connections are established on the fly for each request and are destroyed afterwards.

docblock.description: Connection options
Set up the connection object, validate the options provided
Issue an HTTP GET request
Issue an HTTP POST request with the data provided
Issue an HTTP PUT request with the data provided
Issue an HTTP DELETE request with the data provided
Parse the response return the body values as an assoc array

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the response as supplied by the server

docblock.description: Execute an HTTP request and return the results
docblock.long-description: This function will throw if no connection to the server can be established or if there is a problem during data exchange with the server. The function might temporarily alter the value of the php.ini value 'default_socket_timeout' but will restore it.

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: value validator
ValueValidator
docblock.long-description: A simple validator for values to be stored in the database

docblock.description: Validate the value of a variable Allowed value types are string, integer, double and booleans. Arrays are also allowed if they contain only one of the former types.

tag.name: return
tag.description: - will throw if an invalid value type is passed

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: URL helper methods
URLHelper
docblock.long-description: Some helper methods to construct and process URLs

docblock.description: Get the document id from a location header
Construct a URL from a base URL and additional parts, seperated with '/' each This function accepts variable arguments.
Append parameters to a URL Parameter values will be URL-encoded
AvocadoDB PHP client: statement
Statement
docblock.long-description: Container for a select statement A statement is an SQL-like query that can be issues to the server. Optional bind parameters can be used when issueing the statement to separate the statement from the values. Executing a statement will result in a cursor being created.

docblock.description: Query string index
Count option index
Batch size index
Bind variables index
The connection object
The bind variables and values used for the statement
The current batch size (number of result documents retrieved per roundtrip)
The count flag (should server return total number of results)
The query string
Sanitation flag (if set, the _id and _rev attributes will be removed from the results)
Initialise the statement
Execute the statement This will post the query to the server and return the results as a Cursor. The cursor can then be used to iterate the results.
Invoke the statement This will simply call execute(). Arguments are ignored.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - arguments for invocation, will be ignored

docblock.description: Return a string representation of the statement
Bind a parameter to the statement This method can either be called with a string $key and a separate value in $value, or with an array of all bind bind parameters in $key, with $value being NULL.
docblock.long-description: Allowed value types for bind parameters are string, int, double, bool and array. Arrays must not contain any other than these types.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - name of bind variable OR an array of all bind variables

docblock.description: Get all bind parameters as an array
Set the query string
Get the query string
Set the count option for the statement
Get the count option value of the statement

Set the batch size for the statement The batch size is the number of results to be transferred in one server roundtrip. If a query produces more results than the batch size, it creates a server-side cursor that provides the additional results. The server-side cursor can be accessed by the client with subsequent HTTP requests.
Get the batch size for the statement
Build an array of data to be posted to the server when issueing the statement

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of data to be sent to server

docblock.description: Return an array of cursor options
AvocadoDB PHP client: result set cursor
Cursor
docblock.long-description: Provides access to the results of a select statement The cursor might not contain all results in the beginning. If the result set is too big to be transferred in one go, the cursor might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch the remaining results from the server.

docblock.description: base URL part for cursor related operations
result entry for cursor id, result row entry for document id
result row entry for revision id
result entry for "hasMore" flag
result entry for result documents
sanitize option entry
The connection object
Cursor options
The result set
"has more" indicator - if true, the server has more results
cursor id - might be NULL if cursor does not have an id
current position in result set iteration (zero-based)
total length of result set (in number of documents)
Initialise the cursor with the first results and some metadata

tag.name: param
tag.description: - initial result data as returned by the server

docblock.description: Explicitly delete the cursor This might issue an HTTP DELETE request to inform the server about the deletion.

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if the server acknowledged the deletion request, false otherwise

docblock.description: Get the total number of results in the cursor This might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch any outstanding results from the server
Get all results as an array This might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch any outstanding results from the server
Rewind the cursor, necessary for Iterator
Return the current result row, necessary for Iterator

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the current result row as an assoc array

docblock.description: Return the index of the current result row, necessary for Iterator
Advance the cursor, necessary for Iterator
Check if cursor can be advanced further, necessary for Iterator This might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch any outstanding results from the server

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if the cursor can be advanced further, false if cursor is at end

docblock.description: Sanitize the result set rows This will remove the _id and _rev attributes from the results if the "sanitize" option is set

tag.name: param
tag.description: - array of rows to be sanitized

docblock.description: Fetch outstanding results from the server
Set the length of the (fetched) result set
AvocadoDB PHP client: document handler
DocumentHandler
docblock.long-description: A document handler that fetches documents from the server and persists them on the server. It does so by issueing the appropriate HTTP requests to the server.

docblock.description: URL base part for all document-related REST calls
documents array index
Connection object
Construct a new document handler
Get a single document from a collection This will throw if the document cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as a string or number

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the document fetched from the server

docblock.description: Get the list of all documents' ids from a collection This will throw if the list cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: return
tag.description: - ids of documents in the collection

docblock.description: Add a document to a collection This will add the document to the collection and return the document's id This will throw if the document cannot be created

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

docblock.description: Update an existing document in a collection This will update the document on the server This will throw if the document cannot be updated

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

docblock.description: Delete a document from a collection

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - document id OR document to be updated

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

docblock.description: Helper function to get a document id from a document or a document id value

tag.name: param
tag.description: - document id OR document to be updated

tag.name: return
tag.description: - document id, will throw if there is an error

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: bind variables
BindVars
docblock.long-description: A simple container for bind variables This container also handles validation of the bind values.

docblock.description: Current bind values
Get all registered bind variables

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of all registered bind variables

docblock.description: Get the number of bind variables registered
Get the value of a bind variable with a specific name
Set the value of a single bind variable or set all bind variables at once This will also validate the bind values.
docblock.long-description: Allowed value types for bind parameters are string, int, double, bool and array. Arrays must not contain any other than these types.

tag.name: param
tag.description: name - name of bind variable OR an array with all bind variables

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: connection options
ConnectionOptions
docblock.long-description: Simple container for connection options. This class also provides the default values for the connection options and will perform a simple validation of them. It provides array access to its members.

docblock.description: Host name string index constant
Port number index constant
Timeout value index constant
Trace function index constant
The current options
Set defaults, use options provided by client and validate them
Get all options
Set and validate a specific option, necessary for ArrayAccess
Check whether an option exists, necessary for ArrayAccess

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if option exists, false otherwise

docblock.description: Remove an option and validate, necessary for ArrayAccess
Get a specific option, necessary for ArrayAccess

tag.name: return
tag.description: - value of option, will throw if option is not set

docblock.description: Get the default values for the options
Validate the options

tag.name: return
tag.description: - will throw if an invalid option value is found

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: connect exception
ConnectException
docblock.long-description: This will be thrown by the client when there is an error during connecting to the server

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: single document
Document
docblock.long-description: Value object representing a single collection-based document

docblock.description: Document id index
Revision id index
The document id (might be NULL for new documents)
The document revision (might be NULL for new documents)
The document attributes (names/values)
Flag to indicate whether document was changed locally
Constructs an empty document
Factory method to constructs a new document using the values passed to populate it
Clone a document Returns the clone
Get a string representation of the document Returns the document as JSON-encoded string
Returns the document as JSON-encoded string
Returns the document as a serialized string
Set a document attribute
docblock.long-description: The key (attribute name) must be a string. This will validate the value of the attribute and might throw an exception if the value is invalid.

docblock.description: Set a document attribute, magic method
docblock.long-description: This is a magic method that allows the object to be used without declaring all document attributes first. This function is mapped to set() internally.

docblock.description: Get a document attribute

tag.name: return
tag.description: - value of attribute, NULL if attribute is not set

docblock.description: Get a document attribute, magic method This function is mapped to get() internally.

tag.name: return
tag.description: - value of attribute, NULL if attribute is not set

docblock.description: Get all document attributes
Set the changed flag
Get the changed flag

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if document was changed, false otherwise

docblock.description: Set the document id This will throw if the id of an existing document gets updated to some other id

Get the document id (if already known) Document ids are generated on the server only. Document ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a document id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used

tag.name: return
tag.description: - document id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

docblock.description: Set the document revision Revision ids are generated on the server only. Document ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a document id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used
Get the document revision (if already known)

tag.name: return
tag.description: - revision id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: client exception
ClientException
docblock.long-description: This will be thrown by the client when there is an error on the client side, i.e. something the server is not involved in.

docblock.description: AvocadoDB PHP client: HTTP response
HttpResponse
docblock.long-description: Container class for HTTP responses

docblock.description: The header retrieved
The body retrieved
All headers retrieved as an assoc array
The result statusline (first line of HTTP response header)
The HTTP status code of the response
Set up the response

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the complete HTTP response as supplied by the server

docblock.description: Return the HTTP status code of the response
Return an individual HTTP headers of the response

tag.name: return
tag.description: - header value, NULL if header wasn't set in response

docblock.description: Return the HTTP headers of the response

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of all headers with values

docblock.description: Return the body of the response
Return the result line (first header line) of the response

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the result line (first line of header)

docblock.description: Return the data from the JSON-encoded body

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of values from the JSON-encoded response body

docblock.description: Set up an array of HTTP headers
